This resulted in a revenue loss of Rs 725 crore. The report highlights issues like ineligible products, incorrect rates, and non-realization of export proceeds. CAG recommends automation and stronger verification to prevent future misuse of incentives.

items.title: Bharti Airtel plans  ₹15,740 crore capital raise through partly-paid shares; check record date and price
items.summary: Bharti Airtel's board approved a final call on partly paid-up equity shares at  ₹401.25 each, raising  ₹15,740 crore. The record date is February 06, 2026, with payment from March 02 to March 16, 2026.

items.title: Goldman Sachs and Shark Anupam Mittal-backed Travelstack Tech files DRHP for IPO
items.summary: Travelstack Tech, backed by Goldman Sachs and Anupam Mittal, has filed DRHP for an IPO combining a Rs 250 crore fresh issue and offer for sale, with proceeds funding working capital, debt repayment and growth as corporate travel demand expands in India.

items.title: Food delivery sees 27% rise in employment, but experts flag a hidden malaise
items.summary: Gig workers' representatives and policy experts said growing job numbers actually hide distress across the gig economy, and that more people are engaging in such work because of rising unemployment.

items.title: CCI to probe IndiGo over flight disruptions, abuse of dominance
items.summary: The Competition Commission of India has initiated an investigation into InterGlobe Aviation-led IndiGo, following a wave of flight cancellations and delays across India.

items.title: Bond worries are rising. Why selling is a mistake.
items.summary: Easing monetary, fiscal, and regulatory policies creates a “triple easing,” which means the current credit cycle has room to run.

items.summary: The FTA is specifically engineered to boost labour-intensive sectors

items.title: Upcoming IPO: Travelstack Tech files DRHP with SEBI for  ₹250 crore IPO
items.summary: Travelstack Tech has filed a Draft Red Herring Prospectus with SEBI to raise  ₹250 crore through an IPO. The funds will support working capital, repayment of borrowings, and corporate purposes.

items.title: Time to be cautious on sectoral, thematic funds; gold a must in portfolios: Harshvardhan Roongta
items.summary: For investors reviewing or starting their portfolios now, Roongta advised focusing on discipline rather than trends. “Ask yourself whether you are following a long-term asset allocation plan or simply reacting to recent market performance,” he said. He added that changes in asset allocation should only be made based on risk profile, financial goals, and time horizon—not past returns.

items.title: Sundaram Home Finance targets 100 Emerging Business branches by year end
items.summary: The company expanded its presence to around 50 EB branches in a phased manner over 3 years, it said in a release

The issuance was done by its subsidiary, Vodafone Idea Telecom Infrastructure Limited. This move offers the company much-needed financial flexibility.

items.title: Falling Indian rupee comes to Nifty IT's rescue, helps beat Nifty 50 over 3 months: Should you bet?
items.summary: The Nifty IT index has surged nearly 15% since October, outperforming the Nifty 50, thanks to a weakening rupee. Shares of Persistent Systems have surged 31% since October, followed by LTIMindtree and HCL Technologies, which have jumped 21% and 20%, respectively, for the same period.

items.title: Bharti Airtel succession plan: Shashwat Sharma named MD & CEO; Gopal Vittal to be executive vice chairman
items.summary: Bharti Airtel succession plan: Telecom major Bharti Airtel's board appointed Gopal Vittal as the executive vice chairman, while Shashwat Sharma will become the new CEO effective 1 January 2026.

items.title: Meesho short-selling shares under auction: Nithin Kamath explains how investors can participate and earn profit
items.summary: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath reveals that short delivery auctions are driving sharp post-listing IPO gains, punishing short sellers. These auctions, triggered when traders fail to deliver shares, force them to buy back at significantly higher prices, creating opportunities for existing shareholders to sell at a premium.

items.summary: Mahajan explained that small-cap and mid-cap stocks have seen sharp corrections, but despite more reasonable valuations, they remain risky asset classes. Investors with long-term goals of 10 years or more may consider exposure to small and mid-cap-oriented funds, while those with 7 to 10-year goals should prefer focused or multi-cap funds.

items.title: Retail investors' favourite renewable energy stock poised for first annual drop in 5 years. Is it in your portfolio?
items.summary: Suzlon Energy has experienced a difficult 2025, with shares down 29% from May and 17% overall. While management remains optimistic and brokerages see potential upside, the stock faces challenges from slowing installations and changing market sentiment.

items.title: Shriram Finance calls press meet on December 22 amid reports of MUFG acquiring minority stake
items.summary: Shriram Finance will hold a press conference on 22 December to share strategic updates and business plans. This follows reports of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group planning to acquire a 20% stake in the company.

items.title: Nasdaq sees bigger year ahead for listings on billion-dollar-plus IPOs
items.summary: Nasdaq anticipates a surge in company listings next year. Several major startups are preparing to go public in the US. This signals growing confidence in the market for new offerings. Companies and investors are looking beyond recent market fluctuations. This trend suggests a strong start to the year for IPOs, with optimism for the latter half.

items.summary: Minister of State for Agriculture Bhagirath Choudhary tells Lok Sabha that DBT and CSIR are also involved in genome editing

items.summary: Seven NSE largecap companies, including HDFC Bank and Bajaj Finance, posted their highest quarterly profits in 10 quarters, reflecting strong growth and robust financial performance.

items.summary: The recent increase to 100% FDI in India's insurance sector is poised to reshape the landscape, attracting long-term investments and enhancing consumer trust. Expert Jayant Walia emphasises the need for better service and technology to boost the penetration of insurance in India.

items.title: Bank of England slashes rate by 25 bps to 3.75%; FTSE 100 slips into red
items.summary: The Bank of England has cut its key interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%, citing faster-than-expected inflation decline and ongoing economic weakness. This move, supported by a 5-4 vote, aims to stimulate growth by lowering borrowing costs. The decision follows a weakening jobs market and precedes the European Central Bank's policy announcement.

items.title: Lupin inks licensing pact with Neopharmed for Plasil brand in Philippines, Brazil
items.summary: Pharma major Lupin Limited has secured exclusive marketing rights for the gastroenterology brand Plasil in the Philippines and Brazil. Subsidiaries in these nations inked a deal with Italy's Neopharmed Gentili S.p.A. This move will boost Lupin's gastroenterology offerings and market reach. Plasil treats nausea, vomiting, and motility disorders.

items.title: TVS Supply moves NCLAT against NCLT order rejecting insolvency against ZTE

Accenture beats quarterly revenue estimate
items.summary: Accenture has surpassed revenue forecasts for the first quarter. Strong demand for its artificial intelligence IT services fueled this growth.  The company's AI strategy is showing positive results. Enterprises are increasingly adopting AI for cost reduction and productivity gains.  New bookings also saw a significant rise.  However, demand from public sector clients remains mixed.

items.title: 1 crore shares under auction! After Groww, now Meesho short sellers trapped in 100% stock rally

With just 6% free float and limited supply, bears failed to deliver stock on settlement—underscoring the growing risks of shorting momentum-driven, low-float IPOs.

items.title: India to tackle sugar surplus with higher exports, ethanol diversion
items.summary: India’s sugar production in the 2025/26 marketing year, which began on October 1, is projected to rise 18% to 30.9 million metric tons, even after diverting 3.4 million tons for ethanol production, Chopra said

This ambitious plan, involving an estimated Rs 40,000 crore investment, aims to meet the state's escalating power needs. The company's initial 1,600 MW phase is already underway, solidifying its commitment to the region's energy infrastructure.

items.summary: Max Healthcare will invest over Rs 1,000 crore to build a new 450-bed super speciality hospital in Pune. This facility in Yerawada will be commissioned within three years. It marks Max Healthcare's entry into Pune and will be its fourth hospital in Western India. The company aims to bring advanced medical care to the region.

items.summary: Losses in energy, auto and pharma shares dragged indices down, while gains in IT shares helped trim losses. Select buying in financials and metals also aided recovery in the pre-close session

items.title: New Avatar leads a late year-ender show that promises to light up the box-office
items.summary: Avatar is set to release in India this week, with expectations of  ₹20-30 crore on opening day. The film's established legacy and fan base, alongside successful Bollywood films, could enhance the overall box office performance as the year concludes.

items.title: India to tackle sugar surplus with higher exports, ethanol diversion
items.summary: India plans to protect sugarcane farmers from income losses by managing surplus sugar supplies through increased exports and diverting more for ethanol production. The government aims to contain the surplus, projected to rise significantly in the 2025/26 marketing year, to prevent price drops and ensure timely farmer payments.

items.title: From reels to real money: India’s micro-drama explosion faces tests
items.summary: Micro-dramas are stories built for the mobile phone, not the living room. Barely a minute or two long, they’re reshaping the viewing habits of millions of Indians with their twists and cliffhangers. But behind the headlong rush lie many questions.

items.summary: Oman has offered zero-duty access on over 98% of its tariff lines (or product categories), covering 99.38% of India's exports to Oman.

items.title: FinMin unveils new logo for Regional Rural Banks to signify a single, unified brand identity
items.summary: On the principle of 'One State One RRB', the Department of Financial Services, Ministry of Finance, has consolidated 26 Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) across 11 states/UTs, effective from May 1, 2025.

items.summary: Reliance Consumer Products Limited has acquired a majority stake in Udhaiyams Agro Foods Private Limited. This move brings the Tamil Nadu staples and nutrition brand Udhaiyam into Reliance's portfolio. Reliance will hold a controlling stake in the joint venture. Udhaiyams' existing promoters will retain a minority holding. Financial details of the transaction were not disclosed.

items.summary: India exported $4.06 billion worth of merchandise to Oman in 2024-25, which made up 0.93% of India’s total exports that year. It imported $6.5 billion worth of goods from Oman, comprising 0.91% of India’s total imports in 2024-25.

items.title: Soon, you won’t need to stop at highway tolls: Nitin Gadkari
items.summary: National highway plazas will transition to a multi-lane free flow (MLFF) toll system by the end of 2026, eliminating the need for physical stops. Cameras will read number plates and automatically deduct fees from FASTag accounts, even at speeds of 80 kmph. This initiative aims to save fuel, increase toll revenue, and enhance transparency.

items.title: India's free trade agreements: An explainer
items.summary: India has signed trade deals with Sri Lanka, Bhutan, Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, Japan, Australia, the UAE, Mauritius, ASEAN, and the EFTA countries (Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland)

items.title: Mustard coverage touches 77.06 lakh hectares, up 6% y-o-y
items.summary: Notable expansion in Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and West Bengal, says SEA

items.title: India-Oman FTA: Your 2-minute guide on key trade deal
items.summary: India and Oman have signed a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), marking Oman's first such pact since 2006. The agreement offers significant tariff concessions on goods, including zero-duty access for 98.08% of Oman's tariff lines, and substantial commitments in services, particularly for professional movement.

items.title: India's competition watchdog reviewing allegations of antitrust breaches by IndiGo
items.summary: India's competition watchdog is investigating budget airline IndiGo. This follows widespread flight cancellations that stranded thousands. The airline, which dominates the domestic market, faces allegations of antitrust violations. The disruptions highlighted risks in India's fast-growing aviation sector.

items.title: KTM 160 Duke introduces all-new 5-inch colour TFT display
items.summary: The 5-inch colour TFT display is derived from the Gen-3 KTM 390 Duke. Riders can connect their smartphone to the TFT display through the KTM Connect app via Bluetooth to use KTM’s navigation system on the display

items.title: SHANTI Bill in Rajya Sabha: No compromise on safeguard mechanism in nuclear bill, says Jitendra Singh
items.summary: India's Rajya Sabha is debating the SHANTI Bill, which aims to allow private companies into the civil nuclear sector. Union Minister Jitendra Singh assured that safety measures will not be compromised. The move supports India's growing global role and clean energy goals. Nuclear power offers reliable 24x7 energy, unlike other renewables.

items.title: India includes traditional medicine in free trade agreement with Oman
items.summary: India and Oman have signed a new trade deal. This agreement is the first to include traditional medicine systems. It will boost market access for Indian Ayush products in Oman. The deal promotes cooperation in licensing, research, and medical travel.

items.title: Antitrust action: Competition panel launches probe into IndiGo following flight disruptions
items.summary: IndiGo is facing a PIL in the Delhi High Court following the operational collapse, during which over 4,600 flights were cancelled, which left more than 1.2 million passengers stranded at various airports

items.title: Japan's Sumitomo Realty puts India bet on Mumbai and serviced apartments
items.summary: Japan's Sumitomo Realty and Development is making a unique foray into India's real estate market, focusing solely on Mumbai.  Instead of selling properties, the developer plans to manage and rent out apartments in its upcoming "super-high-rise" projects. This strategy aims to capitalize on Mumbai's rising rents and its perceived stability, differentiating Sumitomo from other international players.

items.title: India-Oman trade deal signed as New Delhi seeks to de-risk exports amid tariff war
items.summary: The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), which covers goods, services and investment, was signed during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's two-day visit to Muscat.

items.summary: Khan has spent over 20 years with the broadcasting company across two stints

items.title: India-Oman trade agreement: India excludes dairy, gold, silver, footwear from trade pact with Oman
items.summary: India has secured its farmers and small businesses in a new trade deal with Oman. Sensitive items like dairy, gold, and footwear will not receive duty cuts. Some Omani exports to India will get limited duty benefits under a quota system. Oman will allow Indian firms to import marble blocks, a previously banned item.

items.title: Rupee rises 12 paise to close at 90.26 against US dollar
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 90.35 against the US dollar, then recovered some lost ground to touch an intra-day high of 90.04, registering a 34 paise gain from its previous close

items.summary: Both asset management styles being poles apart, it has so happened that the right education regarding the benefits of passive investing has not been done due to conflicted asset management business models, says Hemen Bhatia of Angel One AMC.

items.title: Nexon at Rs 7,999, Punch Rs 5,999: Tata Motors announces special December EMI scheme for 10 cars
items.summary: Tata Motors introduces attractive financing for its vehicle range. Customers can drive home a Tiago with EMIs as low as INR 4,999. The Curvv.ev is available with EMIs up to INR 14,555. These offers provide flexible payment plans for both petrol and electric models. This special financing opportunity is available until December 31, 2025.

items.title: L Catterton bets on Haldiram’s as India snacks market heats up
items.summary: L Catterton has invested in Haldiram Snacks, aiming to enhance its growth in India and expand internationally. The partnership will focus on product development and distribution efficiency, capitalizing on Haldiram's established brand in the snacks market.

items.title: Cyient Semiconductors to acquire majority stake in U.S. firm Kinetic Tech for $93 million
items.summary: The objective behind acquiring the stake in Kinetic, which was incorporated in 2006 and estimated to close 2025 with $41 million in revenue, is to drive custom power IC leadership for Edge AI and high-performance compute markets.

items.title: Weak Indian rupee is good for export, but not as good as it seems
items.summary: The Indian rupee has seen recent volatility. While a weaker rupee is often seen as good for exports, new studies indicate its positive impact on trade balance is limited. Sectors heavily reliant on imported inputs see their export gains diluted. Only food and agro-based exports consistently benefit. Labour-intensive sectors like textiles and leather are negatively impacted.

items.title: Rupee extends intervention-spurred rise, merchant flows dominate
items.summary: The Indian rupee saw a slight gain on Thursday, recovering from a record low after the Reserve Bank of India's market intervention. Traders noted increased dollar sales and reduced speculative bets against the rupee. Analysts at HSBC recommend selling USD/INR, forecasting the rupee to reach 88 against the dollar by March 2026.

items.title: RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group commits ₹15,800 crore capex in Bengal
items.summary: Group to develop bolstering the energy, education, and healthcare sectors in West Bengal

items.summary: Markets are bracing for volatility ahead of the Bank of Japan’s policy decision, as a potential unwind of the yen carry trade could trigger foreign selling, pressure emerging markets and test Indian equities, though strong domestic participation may limit deeper downside risks.

items.title: Micromanagers are everywhere—which may be why it’s easy to spot one in the mirror
items.summary: Micromanaging is exhausting, but we often confuse the need to stay relevant with the need to be visibly in charge of everything. Resist it—micromanagement stifles initiative and creativity, instils fear and gets in the way of decision-making. All this weakens a team’s ability to function effectively

items.title: Pernod’s Xclamat!on to raise competition in premium alcobev; Radico still top pick: Karan Taurani
items.summary: Pernod Ricard’s new Xclamat!on spirits launch is set to intensify competition in India’s premium alcohol market, says Karan Taurani, Executive Vice-President at Elara Securities. While innovation boosts premiumisation, Radico Khaitan remains the top stock pick. The India-UK FTA could further accelerate luxury spirit demand and improve margins across the alcobev sector.

items.title: EPFO urges employers to enroll left out employees, gives special compliance window of six months

items.summary: Ahead of listing on Friday, the shares of ICICI Prudential AMC IPO are commanding a strong premium in the grey market, signalling a 21% listing pop.

items.title: A new lens on employee health: Policybazaar for Business launches AiSHA, an AI-powered smart health face scan
items.summary: Policybazaar for Business has launched AiSHA, an AI-powered health assistant for corporate clients. This platform uses a 30-second smartphone face scan to provide real-time health insights, including heart rate and stress levels. AiSHA aims to shift corporate health towards prevention and early detection, offering personalized guidance and integrations for a unified preventive-care ecosystem.

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Dec 18: HDFC AMC, Hindustan Copper, PB Fintech, IndiGo, Hindustan Zinc among top gainers
items.summary: The Indian stock market remained largely unchanged on December 18, following three days of losses. Weak global cues kept sentiment subdued, while the Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 indices saw slight gains. FPIs turned net buyers, investing  ₹1,171 crore in equities.

Mid- and small-caps outperformed. The rupee strengthened slightly, global cues remained mixed, and investors eyed central bank decisions and U.S.–India trade talks.

The agreement was signed in Muscat during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit. It is expected to enhance trade and investment. This partnership strengthens India's economic presence in the Middle East region.

items.title: Home loan disbursements in India to reach Rs 150 lakh crore by 2035: Report
items.summary: India's housing finance sector is set for a historic boom, with projections indicating Rs 150 trillion in home loan disbursements over the next decade.  Demographics, urbanization, and government policies are fueling this growth, with mortgage penetration still significantly low.  This presents a substantial, multi-year opportunity for sustained expansion.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 end flat amid lack of fresh triggers; IT stocks shine— 10 key highlights

The Reserve Bank of India intervenes to manage sharp currency movements. India pursues trade talks aggressively, prioritizing national interest. These negotiations could influence future trade flows and the rupee's path.
